title: How death taxes are killing the housing market
text:
Inheritance tax rules are clogging up the property market by stopping older people from downsizing, due to a lack of knowledge about overcomplicated reliefs specifically designed to prevent the problem.

Protections that allow homeowners to pass on more of their wealth when they die are having the unintended effect of encouraging elderly people to hold on to larger, more valuable homes that may not suit their needs so they can benefit fully from the tax breaks.
